servinfo.title: DTC P0108: Manifold Absolute Pressure Circuit High Input

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0106: Manifold Absolute Pressure Range / Performance .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Manifold absolute pressure sensor output voltage is higher than specified value for specified time continuously.

attention3.ptxt: When DTC P0113, P0118 and P0533 are indicated together, it is possible that “GRY/GRN” wire circuit is open.

s1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool and warm up engine completely.
Run engine at idle speed for 1 min.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

testgroup.title: MAP sensor and its circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch OFF.
Check intake manifold pressure displayed on scan tool.

testgroup.question: Is it 127 kPa (37.5 in.Hg)?

paragroup.ptxt: Intermittent trouble. Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

testgroup.title: MAP sensor power supply voltage check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from MAP sensor with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection of MAP sensor at “GRY/RED”, “RED/WHT” and “GRY/GRN” wire terminals.
Turn ON ignition switch, measure voltage between engine ground and “GRY/RED” wire terminal of MAP sensor connector.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 4 – 6 V?

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “GRY/GRN” wire terminal of MAP sensor connector and engine ground with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between “C37-57” terminal of ECM connector and vehicle body ground.

action.ptxt: “GRY/GRN” wire is open or high resistance circuit.

paragroup.ptxt: ECM grounds “C37-58”, “C37-48”, “C37-30”, “C37-29” and/or “C37-15” circuit are open or high resistance.
If wires are OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Measure voltage between “RED/WHT” wire terminal of MAP sensor connector and engine ground.
Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between “RED/WHT” wire terminal of MAP sensor connector and “C37-55” terminal of ECM connector.

action.ptxt: “RED/WHT” wire is shorted to power supply circuit.
“RED/WHT” wire is open or high resistance circuit.

test1.ptxt: Check MAP sensor according to Manifold Absolute Pressure (MAP) Sensor Inspection .

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
